snippet: President Obama this week is expected to embrace a plan to reduce gun violence that will also lay out separate actions he could take himself, without approval from Congress.
abstract: Pres Obama will embrace comprehensive plan to reduce gun violence, calling for major legislation but also laying out 19 separate actions that could be taken by invoking the power of his office rather than attempting to push new rules through bitterly divided Congress; strategy reflects uncertainty of gun politics in America and desire of administration to address Newtown, Conn, shooting while also confronting broader deficiencies in nation's criminal justice and mental health systems.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and JENNIFER STEINHAUER

lead_paragraph: President Obama this week is expected to embrace a plan to reduce gun violence that will also lay out separate actions he could take himself, without approval from Congress.

headline.seo: Obama Poised to Back Comprehensive Plan to Curb Gun Violence
headline.main: Obama Willing to Use Executive Orders on Guns
headline.print_headline:
New York Has Gun Deal,
With Focus on Mental Ills;
Obama’s Plan to Be Broad: Willingness to Use
Executive Orders
to Take Action
